column4: Uh, I just ran into another problem.  I'm trying to install Folding@home, but it says the program has an unknown filetype.
But I'm pretty sure I downloaded the right version.
I downloaded it.
And tried to run the installer.
Plus, Google Chrome (a .deb file) won't install either.
Can you still install stuff from apt-get?
apt-get?
Yeah, in most Debian systems, apt-get is a CLI thing.
I'm new to this, so I don't know what that is.
sudo apt-get install foo bar baz
Something you enter in terminal. As an example:
sudo apt-get install wine
Wait a second...
Is Synaptic or Update Manager open?
Hold on.  I think I might have got it.
Because they use the apt-get protocol, and to avoid nastiness with having multiple programs installing using the same command-line stuff, only one program at a time utilizing apt is allowed to run.
Example, if I have synaptic open, and using the software center to install something, I need to close synaptic for software center to function.
Otherwise, please give us the error when you apt-get something.
Copy from terminal (Ctrl+Shift+C) what it says when you run sudo apt-get install --reinstall gedit
(Using gedit as the example, you can reinstall other programs as well simply to produce debug text.)
I did download it from terminal, and I opened the folder, but none of the programs seem to be the installer.
